Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Friendly_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel close to the US Consulate, looked at maps and chose this one due to rating on here. Only 2 blocks from Consulate so matched my criteria but also a great location for old town and restaurants. Next to Convention Centre so ideal location if you are attending an event there. Also surprised at how quiet it was once in the room, no banging of doors and other noises you normally hear in a hotel. Good price for location and facilities - breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: s b
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel--it is in a FABULOUS LOCATION - WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE to EVERYTHING in the Montreal area! Literally down the street from Old Montreal /Old Port! The hotel is quiet,clean and contemporary--wood floors, flat screen tv, free wifi and computer! The bathrooms are ultra modern and have heated tile floors! The view from our room was very nice! The hotel also offers a free basic complimentary breakfast---coffee,muffins, yogurt, fruit, etc. it wasn't great, but it served the purpose! Their parking garage is small and limited, but there is plenty of parking at the convention center right next door. The hotel is so close to everything, that we didn't use our car at all!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gucci85
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. I was surprised to see how quiet it was, we felt like we were the only ones in the hotel. The room was big, clean and modern. A continental breakfast was included, and there again we were the only ones there. Good location, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Lily7402
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend and we were extremely pleased. The rooms were large, modern, and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. As an added bonus every room has its own computer with free WiFi which was invaluable for us as we didn't bring a laptop. The hotel is situated perfectly for walking around Vieux Montreal, and access to other areas of the city is very easy via the Place d'Armes Metro stop which is right nearby. A 3-day Metro pass gets you unlimited rides on both the Metro and the buses for only $16 per person. We highly recommend the Hotel Dauphin and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelMuff
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. First in 2009 and again in 2011. I first found it through Google Map while trying to find hotels by the Palais de Congres. Most of the other hotels close by were sold out but this one wasn't and the price was pretty decent. I also brought along a friend and we split the difference. At the time, there was also a computer in the room but I see that they discontinued that and just offer free wi-fi now. Too bad I don't have a laptop. Anyway, second time I stayed here was last minute. I only needed to stay for one night and didn't even need to look up other hotels. I had loved this hotel from my previous stay. The breakfast is free and great too. I also luv the alarm clock they added built in with an iPod docking station. Next time, I will bring my iPod with me. In the end, this is a small quaint hotel located right by the Palais de Congres and Chinatown. I didn't go explore anywhere else in Montreal but it's probably close to the port and Old Montreal too.

Reviews.Title: “simple but perfect”
Reviews.Author: esperant0
Reviews.Content: we spent a night here on our way from Toronto to Eastern Township.

Reviews.Title: “a weekend with friends”
Reviews.Author: chantalb1315
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip at this hotel and I loved it. Very nice location, could walk for shopping malls and restaurants. Would go back anytime and the staff was very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: gar40
Reviews.Content: Great stay,great location,very clean and modern rooms will visit again next time in Montreal close to everything! Fridge,safe and desk top computer in room. adequate breakfast-cereal,hb-eggs,bagels,toast,coffee,tea,juice,apples,bananas.yogurt,cheese.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: UESgal
Reviews.Content: Walk to the Notre Dame Basilica, the super hip shops and galleries at Rue St. Paul, subway at Square Victoria. Modern room (we had standard king), comfy bed, nice bamboo (?) floors are always better and more sanitary than carpet. Great to had PC in the room with free WiFi and a small fridge to store your goods. Good coffee but otherwise basic breakfast fare. Two minor things: wish there was easier control of the heated bathroom floors; and we could hear our neighbors next door - not conversation, but more like "thug" sounds - luggage being dropped on the floor maybe, closet doors banging, not exactly sure. But for what we paid we'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: linkjess
Reviews.Content: The great location, sandwiched between St. Catherine and Old Montreal, close to Place d'Armes metro stop and underground city access, made this the perfect hotel for our stay. Using this as a home base we got to see everything we wanted to, even in snowy and cold January. The price (we went through expedia and got a 40% discount) was super low for the quality of the hotel. Our room was clean and very large, with a fairly comfortable king bed. The walk-in tile shower and heated floor in the bathroom were excellent. The digital thermostat was great and in a cold Montreal winter it was nice to be able to crank the heat! The service was friendly and bi-lingual. There's an included breakfast, but it wasn't that good. A few cereal options, some yogurt and toast, along with an automated coffee machine that makes watery lattes.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tlarocque
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful but I have received the worst service ever. First of all, I had a hard time getting my laggage in the door. The person at the desk did make eye contact and did not offer any help. she prefered her reading. Thank's for a stranger passing by. I go to my room. Second, I make a reservation for a queen size bed room and then they changed it for a 2 double bed. They make me, without offering any help, go take my luggage out and bring it to the other room. Third, the cleaning person broke my prescription glasses. And the last but not least, a young guy working at the front desk was the rudest person I ever met. He was rude to me and the person next to me at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “French Gem - Will Return”
Reviews.Author: deeberz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Dauphin Downtown Montreal early November 2011 for two nights. I will stick to the basics for this review, even though it is a bit late. Parking - though there is parking available at the hotel, there was no room for our vehicle (I believe they only have 6 or 7 spots) so we were directed to park at the Congress Centre underground for $24 per 24 hours with no in and out privileges. We were able to park in front of the hotel to unload our stuff to our room. The parking is on the next block and more convenient than we originally thought. And it's quite nice to walk through the Congress Centre. Definitely not a set back as everything was within walking distance to the hotel. Rooms - Our room was immaculate. A king size bed with updated linens, comfy pillows, a large bar fridge and a large electronic safe that was easy to use. We also had a side table with a leather chair and a desk with a chair. There was a large enough dresser that also served as the TV stand. The television was modern with DVD player. On the nightstand was an iPod dock/alarm clock which was a nice surprise. The bathroom is also updated, a bit small but the shower stall was large and there was enough counter space for all of my feminine necessities. Definitely sufficient for the two of us. The breakfast included boiled eggs, Fairmount sesame and plain bagels, white and brown bread (with ample toasters), yogurt, apples, bananas, cheese, peanut butter, jam, cream cheese, cereal, juice, milk, tea and the awesome espresso machine for specialty hot beverages (lattes and cafe au laits). The area is great and within walking distance of the main shopping areas, the old town and Chinatown. The staff is friendly and courteous and were great with offering suggestions for local restaurants. We will definitely stay at this hotel again as we often visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in montreal”
Reviews.Author: flandaz
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at dauphin and it wont be the last. We love the central location, decent price, big clean rooms and free breakfast. Our room this time was even bigger than the last, so spacious. There are fridges in the room and a computer with free internet, The computer was reaaaaallly slow, but it is free. There are wood floors and nice minimalist decor. The king size bed was huge and comfy. The shower has no tub, but a beautiful shower stall with detachable shower head, good pressure. There is a decent size LG flat screen tv with good channel selection. The fridge is pretty big and there is a safe in the room. The alarm clock has an iPod dock. Housekeeping came by twice to clean, we were sleeping the first time. The room, bed and bathroom was super clean. Temperature control is in the room. The breakfast is decent, offered in a breakfast room. Not a lot of hot selection, but there are beans and eggs there, bagels, pastries, toast, cereal, coffees, teas and fresh fruits. The second day there were no eggs so not a lot of protein selection, but still lots of fruit and breads. Reception was friendly, no complaints there. The hotel is central, a few blocks from ste catherine st. There is no pool and I'm unsure if there's a workout room or not. We were happy with our stay, great for the price and very clean. I would give it "excellent" rating but realize that some travelers may find it rather basic, even though I quite like it. The free internet and breakfast make it extra nice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: isdToronto
Reviews.Content: Location is great; just between St. Catherine and Old Montreal. Rooms are spacious, renovated and clean. Breakfast is a nice touch. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele M
Reviews.Content: I stayed two separate nights at Hotel Dauphin, in two different rooms, stopping over on a train trip to Quebec City. I could walk to the train station from the hotel in about 15 minutes. A taxi is about 5 minutes and $6 from the train station. The hotel is also in about 15 minutes walking distance from the old city of Montreal, and about 10 minutes from Chinatown. It's a very modern boutique hotel. There's a key card to ride the elevator, open the door and turn on the lights. There's a high-speed computer in each room, and a flat-screen TV. There's a nice, spare design to the rooms. The bathrooms are well-designed, and lots of little toiletries are offered. The desk clerks were very nice and helpful, speaking fluent English. There's a free breakfast, with lots of different food items offered. I would stay there again on a visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “No Doubts”
Reviews.Author: Khitos
Reviews.Content: If you are hesitant about booking your stay in this hotel, please don't, it's a no-brainer. Le Dauphin is not a luxury hotel, but still their affordable prices don't match the quality and location that you get for your buck. Spotless, safe, quiet (we stayed 5 nights and didn't hear a noise) and only a short walk to Old Montreal and St Catherine. Rooms are equipped with a safe, fridge, flat TV of decent size and a desktop computer with free internet (free WiFi also available). Everything looks new and modern. The free breakfast was a plus, with a cappuccino machine and a good variety of pastries, fruit and cereal. For what is worth, I don't praise hotels lightly, I'm the type of guy that researches 6 months in advance, specially when I travel with my wife and my toddler.

Reviews.Title: “Great value close to Palais des Congress”
Reviews.Author: anthrojason
Reviews.Content: This is a budget friendly, stylish option literally steps from the Palais des Congress and entrance to Chinatown in Montreal. There are two subway stops close by as well. The rooms feature hard wood floors and are tastefully with fresh, minimalist, modern decor. We had the suite upgrade which was only a few dollars more than the regular room and it came with a large black leather sofa and a deep soaking tub. (I'm a big guy and the tub dwarfed me!) There was also a laptop size safe and fridge in the room. The staff were very pleasant and spoke perfect English as well as French. They also accommodated our request to check out an hour late. The breakfast was good, but they ran out later of several items later in the morning so go early for the biggest selection. Our room was very clean and was refreshed daily. Free water bottles in the room daily as well as a yoga mat. Wifi worked great and there was also a computer with internet free in the room, but we didn't use it. There are also lots of restaurants in the area, but some close early-- it's a lunch crowd kinda area. Check out China town for some great options. The man at the front desk recommended a place that was amazing. Some downsides: There was no luggage rack (which seemed odd for such a nice hotel) and the bathroom was lit by two small lights in a cabinet overhanging the sink. This made for some dimly lit showers, but certainly wouldn't prevent me from coming back. All and all a great value (especially for those at the convention center)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value. Great service. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: SnowyPlover
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Dauphin. Our room was very well decorated and perfectly clean. I was thrilled to find that it had hardwood floors (we have allergies and find hotel carpet to be a problem.) I don't know if this is common to all rooms at this hotel as we had been luckily upgraded to a large suite. The desk clerks were extremely helpful and appreciative that we at least tried to speak in French at the beginning of our conversations. It's only a block from a metro stop, which made it a great home-base for exploring Montreal. We were there for the comedy festival and found that we could walk to all events. A few blocks near the venues were a bit sketchy but there were so many people around that we felt fine. There was nothing sketchy about the area around the hotel itself. However, there is one fault. I don't want to knock off a star because it isn't a huge deal but I must say that the breakfast was poor. Sponge-y pastries that must have been frozen, watery coffee, etc. Bottom line: stay here, eat breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: jaa15
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this well-located hotel,, and enjoyed the free computer in the room, the relatively new and modern facility, and the fact that it includes breakfast. The staff was very helpful, whenever we had a question, and they recommended some good and reasonable restaurants in the area. We liked the fact that the hotel was so central. It's just a few blocks from the train station, and across the street from the Convention Center, and very close to Old Town. We would not hesitate to return, and we will recommend Hotel Dauphin to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Unique features, great location, a real bargain”
Reviews.Author: jh137
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations and it has some great features I have not seen in any hotel at any price. This is not a "five star" hotel. There is no bellman, no dining, no pool. Nobody fawning over you for tips. If you don't mind wheeling your bag to your room (you got it as far as the hotel didn't you?) and walking 5 minutes to one of the pretty Old City restaurants, you will find that this hotel is 5-star-plus in every other way. The rooms are large and comfortable, with beautiful modern furniture, firm comfortable beds and lovely soft linens, a free computer in the room (not just wifi, but an actual computer), free printing at the front desk, free breakfast (toast, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, nothing cooked). The room also had a beautiful, triple-size modern shower stall, (no disgusting bathtub with its even more disgusting curtain hugging you), beautiful hardwood floors (no disgusting carpet), a large safe at eye level, a large empty fridge, windows that open, and a nifty master-power switch operated by your keycard that turns all the lights and AC off when you leave. It's like they took away all the useless foofoo bull* that 5 star hotels have, and replaced it with new and unique design features that actually make your stay better, all for free, with no tipping. The front desk staff were very helpful. Five-minute walk to old city. Bixi station 10 paces from front door. 10 minute walk to central station. 5 minute walk to airport bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alter_idem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Loved the flooring since it wasn't carpeting and felt very clean. The hotel is very modern. Loved the security system. The breakfast wasn't bad and the people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The beds were surprisingly firm (usually my husband and I find them very soft) so we had a great night sleep after touring the city. Very happy with our stay here. The location was fantastic because it right in between downtown and old Montreal. Would definitely recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, functional, good value”
Reviews.Content: New, clean, functional place. You get decent size room, large fridge, PC with free internet, free WI-FI, 32" flat screen TV. Everything works, nothing is broken, hotel is brand new. (very basic) Breakfast is included. Location is very good. Parking: it is $22/day at Convention Center a block away - there seem to be cheaper options at open air parking lots though. Last but not the least - it is very reasonably priced and offers great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: aneal12
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to find a reasonably priced hotel in Montreal that also did not have reviews of bed bugs. However, I stumbled upon this hotel and booked immediately in hopes that rooms were still available. Overall, this hotel completely suited our needs and would return here if I traveled to Montreal again. Upon arrival, the staff was friendly and warm and provided a quick check-in. We parked in a temporary spot right outside the hotel doors. They gave us a map for the parking garage (which is $22 a day by the way) and allowed us to take up our bags before leaving. When we got up to the room, we couldnt quite figure out how the lights worked. You need to insert your room key in a slot and keep it there for the lights to stay on. This is to prevent you from leaving on the lights while you are away. The hotel is very modern and clean. We were impressed with our first walk around and were delighted with the glass framed shower. We were originally supposed to get a king sized bed, but received two queen sized beds instead. It was only my significant other and I, so it was not a big deal. There is a free desktop computer with high speed internet, which is a definite bonus. The room also had a safe for personal use and a nice sized mini fridge in which we kept our water. There is also a nice coffee maker included with all the fixings you may need. Two water bottles were provided in the room, but we found a gym which had more water bottles so we decided to borrow a couple. Breakfast was great and included everything you would need and want for even the pickiest eaters. It included toast, muffins, bagels, hard boiled eggs, choice of three cereals, yogurt, cheeses, cappuccino maker, two fresh juices, and plenty of jellies, jams, and peanut butter. My significant other greatly enjoyed the cream choice provided with the bagels. You arent allowed to take the food upstairs so dont expect breakfast in bed. The location is great and is only a 10 minute walk to the Old City district, in which there are plenty of great restaurants, bars, and gift shops. Montreal is generally expensive and this is the most expensive part of the city we stumbled upon. We had a great time walking around and even got the Bixie bikes to bike around the city. It was $5 for 24 hours and was a great value. Beware, the city is full of hills and for the inexperienced biker, this posed a challenge. If you can make it, bike to the top of the "mountain" which provided excellent views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, clean, modern and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: telj76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in August 2011 and this hotel was fabulous for the price paid. We paid approximately 80GBR per night (up to 90 GBR after taxes) and were more than impressed with the hotel for that price. The room we had was spacious, lovely and clean and very modern. The area was also quiet and therefore a good night's sleep is guaranteed. We also had our own pc and fridge in the room which was very convenient. The hotel was only a 10 minute walk from the old town and a 2 minute walk to the nearest metro station. Whilst the view from the hotel was nothing special given the beauty of Montreal we had no complaints whatsoever and would highly recommend this hotel. The gym in the hotel was small but perfectly adequate. Breakfast was a help yourself bagel, cereal and toast affair. I would have liked more fruit but my husband loved it! If you are looking for a nice modern hotel to use as a base for exploring Montreal then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Get-away Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristenc83
Reviews.Content: We came to Montreal to celebrate our 10th anniversary---this was the perfect place to stay. The staff was friendly, rooms were modern, clean and very quiet. It was in close proximity to everything we wanted to see and do! The only negative was that the beds are extra firm as we read in other reviews before we came, but we still slept OK. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thodorito
Reviews.Content: I was worried at first about staying at the Hotel Dauphin in downtown Montreal because the reviews were so great but the price was so low compared to other hotels in Montreal and it was only officially a three star hotel. All the trip advisor reviews though were on par. The room was a great size with a nice fridge, a good size safe (can fit a laptop), a nice flat screen TV with a DVD player and an in room desktop computer. The computer can be a little slow but it's more than useful. It's also very clean (the wood floors are really nice) and the bathroom has nice modern fixtures. There was also free wifi in the room to connect to your own device but this was a little difficult to connect to. Luckily, it only required one log on per day and after that it was nice and speedy to use. Other than that, there really was nothing negative to say about the room at all. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. The best part of the hotel: perfect location. It is walkable to central Montreal and the old city and it is right next to the Convention center which houses both a metro and the underground tunnels believe (RESO - although I might be wrong on this since we didn't use it). In addition, there is a Bixi rent-a-bike literally around the corner (5 steps from the hotel door!) and renting a bike is the best way to see the city (only $5 a day for the bike and you can ride it anywhere and drop it off anywhere for up to 30 minutes at a time - check it in and back out if you've passed the 30 minutes and keep riding!). Some of the staff can even help you with what streets to bike on to avoid some steep uphills. The only negative I could come up with is the parking. We had to park at the convention center, which although was very close (one block away) and very safe to walk to (at anytime of the day/night) and safe to keep parked, you couldn't really take it out except after 24 hours or else you would incur more charges. Parking is $20 and you get the ticket from the hotel so everything gets charged to your room. A little inconvenient but luckily the bikes took us EVERYWHERE we wanted to go in the city. Oh and there is a continental breakfast which is exactly what everyone says it is: good enough especially considering that it's inclusive. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable and convenient to convention center”
Reviews.Author: TX3travelers
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the Montreal convention center the end of July and stayed at the Dauphin Hotel across the street. Rooms were clean, quiet, and contained a computer which was great for checking email (operating system is in French but I managed). Breakfast of boiled eggs, muffins, bagels, croissant, cereal, yogart, cheese, juice, coffee, tea provided. Need to use your room key in the elevator. There is a Metro station inside the convention center so it's easy to access the subway. Easy walking distance to Old Montreal, Chinatown, Rue St. Catherine. I'd stay here again when in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nce Hotel with breakfast. Staff helpful. Strongly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: gallons
Reviews.Content: Nice Modern Hotel. Close to a lot of things in Montreal. Staff was great. Great staging point for a small trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “great affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephaniej
Reviews.Content: I am so happy to have read about this place on trip advisor that I felt compelled to pay it forward with my own review. I would never have known about Hotel Dauphin wihtout reading mostly great reviews and they were right. From the outside you might think not so great but inside different. Small reception area but friendly knowledgeable staff. A few vending machines. But once in your room. Pretty terrific! A refrigerator, a safe, your own Dell computer which worked better than using your own laptop with their connection. By many standards it is a huge roo. We had 2 queen size beds with quite comfortable mattresses (and I have a bad back and was ok). A leather desk chair and 2 other chairs for watching flat screen tv and still plenty of room to move around in. And NO carpet. Wood floors! So much cleaner and less germy. Also a large totally tiled bathroom with modern fixtures for sink and shower. Everything you could wan t unless you were looking for pure luxury, room service etc. The rooms were quite modern with scandanavian style furniture and were very clean and kept that way. Huge windows for light and good block outs for nighttime. Oh, and THE ENTIRE HOTEL IS NON SMOKING AND HAS ALWAYS BEEN THAT WAY! Breakfast was actualy quite good unless you were expecting a hot meal. The coffee machine was to die for wih absolutely the best expresso, latte, cappucino good quality beans and also another machine for regular coffee. Hardboiled eggs, fresh fruits, yogurt, reguar breads for toasting, some mini croissants, HOMEMADE (I saw the do it) bran muffins and sesame bagels from one of the 2 oldest bagel bakeries for which Monrteal is known (a special type of bagel making process). I couldn;t ask for more. Parking was $20USD/nt with in/out privileges and while expensive, it was convenient under the building or overflow down the street.. Elevators worked only with your room key card so good secure place. Sorry some people expected more-but if you go on their website you learn that there is no pool or real restaurant or bar.So there should be no surprises. It is next to the Palais de Congress, near the Metro, walking distance to all of the old city. And a decent rate! My husband once again was thrilled by my research on Trip Advisor. WE rarely get it wrong. Enjoy! Montreal is a wonderful city although expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort, central location.”
Reviews.Author: Orb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Dauphin in early July for a solo trip. The location was central, near a metro and Convention Center. "Vieux Montreal" and the water front are only about a 10-minute walk (and a pleasant walk at that). I also stayed in the Latin Quarter during this trip and I much preferred this area which was further away from the crush of students and bars and more centrally located. The street does have some construction but was fairly quiet while I stayed there (I think the club next door that was the topic of noise complaints has closed). The service was good, decor is very modern and Ikea-like, comfortable beds and a fridge and computer in every room which is very nice. The breakfast is only so-so, hard boiled eggs, breads and cereal but it's convenient and included in the price. As far as price, the rate was far more reasonable than others I had found and I thought the Hotel was over-all an excellent value. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BudgetMom3kids
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located to everything. After our cruise ended in Montreal, we decided to stay a few days and exploe the town. Parents in their 70s and my littles kids all below the age of 8 had a great time. $8 taxi ride from the pier. We walked to Chinatown for dinners and spent the day walking along the water and hitting all trendy places in Old Montreal. The Hotel was very clean. The outside wasn't impressive but the rooms were roomy and very clean. Modern bathroom. Hardwood floor was a bonus. We hate carpets b/c it gets gross and germy. Breakfast was humble but the coffee was very nice. Metro station was only a block away and we took the meto to the Biodoom and had a fun filled day. Can't wait to vsit the city again and will stay at this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked us and sent us into the night ...”
Reviews.Author: mbaird
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked reservations at the Hotel Dauphin months before our trip. He selected the Dauphin because of its proximity to the Jazz Festival. After traveling all day from California and New Mexico, respectively, our family arrived at the Hotel about 10 p.m. on a Friday night with our confirmation in hand. There was one young desk clerk working that night. After we gave her our name, without even looking she told us they were booked up and had no reservation for us. After we protested, her initial response was we might be able to find a hotel "one or two subway stops away." After we complained again she informed us we might be able to find a hotel in the airport area, a 30 minute, $50 dollar cab trip away. We complained again and asked to speak to a manager. She told us no manager was on duty, how convenient, and was not available by phone, although she was speaking to him/her by phone in front of us. I protested again and told her it was obvious they had overbooked the hotel on purpose; she did not deny that. After yet another complaint she got on the phone and located a room for one night at the Marriott, which she said was "around the corner." Rather than arrange a cab for us, she sent us off into the night pulling our luggage behind us. After 20 minutes we located the Marriott some blocks away. I will not recommend the Hotel Dauphin to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great functional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Galameda
Reviews.Content: Great location with many areas accessible on foot and a close metro stop. The hotel is reasonably priced and clean with all the necessities; the free continental breakfast is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tdottony
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel that more than meets travel requirements. Great location, quiet and very clean with a modern decor that looks to be recently renovated. Breakfast is served, added bonus. Don't expect additional amenities. Service is good enough. For the price, decent value for downtown location. Pleaurable stay, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nothing not to like”
Reviews.Author: rdf88
Reviews.Content: There is not much not to like about this hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and kept that way with staff being obliging about when they clean your room. Breakfast is available with quite passable coffee out of the Saeco machine, takeaway fruit, boiled eggs, a range of things to toast, cereal (with a carton of all bran to add), yoghurt and baked beans (which I didnâ€™t see anyone actually eating). Beds are comfortable and warm and there are blinds, clocks and all the things that sleepers might require. Internet is accessible either from a computer in your room (provided by the hotel, although I am not sure how much people actually use this because mine spent a very long time updating itself, suggesting that no one had used it in a while) or from wireless access for your own laptop (slower than the room computer). Phone calls are put through promptly. The hotel is located close to the metro, 747 bus to airport, old town and downtown. You get toiletries, hairdryer, tissues. The shower temperature is regulated and is sometimes not quite warm enough. Stayed here 5 nights and was quite happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: maisoncote
Reviews.Content: I just find this hotel online, I am so happy, great room, very safe, clean, very friendly staff + breakfast every mornng, close to the old Montreal and downtown

Reviews.Title: “I liked the combination, but still room to be better”
Reviews.Author: SMA-ESI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at room 407. (+) : clean rooms , renovated , VERY well equipped and well furnished , nice shower (-) : firm mattress , simple breakfast (not bad, but also not good) , no one helps you moving the luggage and no one to open the two stiff doors for you. suggestion: If it doesn't matter for you to stay in a hotel without a doorman and valet, stay @ this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: whodidit
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews state the same things I think. Nice lobby, friendly staff, great room and bed, close to most everything, free internet in the rooms with a computer, and great price, really great price for what you get. Only thing I could complain about if I had to pick something would be the breakfast. While it is free, it isn't anything special. Also, the cleaning lady did clean the trashcan with a rag and then used the same rag to clean the countertop.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean, friendly, helpful staff, quiet rooms, great beds...”
Reviews.Author: Kathy7235
Reviews.Content: Couple of blocks from old Montreal, central location, very clean rooms....Great for a quick breakfast on the run comes with room price... Best deal for the money..Beds are very comfortable..nice bathroom with shower stall. Will stay here again....The staff was so helpful every time we came to the desk...

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location, Amenities? Doesn't get much bettter!”
Reviews.Author: vwhawley
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Really reminds me of European style hotels. We actually ended up arriving really early like 11 am and just stopped in to see where to eat and they said that we could check in. Fantastic. Garage is small only like 7 spaces or less but worth the $20 especially in the winter. Street parking isn't that cheap, but also convenient. Only stayed 1 night but great bathroom and little gym too. Free continental breakfast is great too! Its so amazingly close to everything. Also has free internet and they have provided computers in the rooms! So central couldn't ask for a better value for the location and what it offers!

Reviews.Title: “It surprises you”
Reviews.Author: dromos01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dauphin surprised me in many ways. First, I felt unsure about my reservation since their reservation system seems antiquated by today's standards. Second, I felt surprise when I arrived at the hotel, by which I mean worried that the webpage perhaps misrepresented thier establishment. Third, the hotel very pleasantly surprised me as I entered the lobby and more-so when I entered the room. As to the rooms, they contain generous and comfortable beds, very fine, spacious bathrooms with all expected amenities (but you can't move the hairdryer around, so my wife lamented), and free internet connection. In addition to the quality and comfort of the hotel, it's quite close to Old Montreal (just take a left outside the hotel and keep walking) and the very vibrant China Town (just take a left outside the hotel). If you like walking, which we do, you can make the Latin Quarter in 15 to 20 minutes by foot (depending on your pace - out of hotel, right, then right again in two blocks and walk straight for 12 or so minutes). The breakfast is substantive if not spectacular, but adequate to the price of the hotel given its aesthetic and geographical qualities. And the staff are all quite informative and pleasant. A good find in an a surprisingly (to continue the theme) expensive city,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: bazarov
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while in Montreal for a wedding this past Labour Day weekend. The accommodations at the Hotel Dauphin are really great - especially for the money. The rooms are very modern and quite spacious (especially for Montreal). In addition, the location of the Dauphin is fantastic. You are within walking distance to the heart of the Old Montreal, which is the most beautiful part of the city, while at the same time within striking distance of the interesting areas close by, including the Latin Quarter, the nightlight on St. Denis and St. Laurent, the downtown shopping districts on St. Catherine, McGill University, and even the charming neighborhood of the Plateau-Mont Royal. The staff of the Dauphin was excellent - we were leaving for the airport at 5am (to catch a 6:30am flight), and knowing we were going to be up that early, the concierge prepared breakfast for us at 4:30am, allowing us to have 20 minutes in advance to grab a bite to eat before heading out. Really - it was beyond the call of duty and very impressive. Admittedly, if I was coming to Montreal for a romantic getaway in the city (and was feeling particularly wealthy), I would probably choose to stay at the Saint Sulpice (albeit, for about twice as much money), however, for nice, reasonable, more budget conscious accommodations, I don't think you can do much better than the Dauphin. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and free inroom computers with wifi”
Reviews.Author: cynspeed
Reviews.Content: This is a true gem of a hotel. We found it to be convenient and clean and large by European standards. We used public transportation and found it to be a short walk from the Jeanne-Mance 747 airport express shuttle stop and close to several metro stations. The hotel supplies each room with a computer and free wi-fi, which we were thrilled with. Please note that it is a french based keyboard and you may have to hunt to find certain keys. The rooms have very contemporary furnishings, what you would find at the IKEA store, if you are familiar. The beds are firm and the bathroom is spacious. There is also a frige, DVD player and safe in the room. You have access to a free washer and dryer, you supply your own laundry soap. They also have a small gym that it is available. I felt very safe in this hotel, you must use your room key for the elevator the bathroom in the lobby. The breakfast is ample, breads for toast, cereals, juice, yogurt, coffees and some fruits. True, no eggs or bacon but more than enough to get off to a good start. We were completely satisfied with the hotel and intend to highly recommend it. We found the desk staff to be very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Up to standard”
Reviews.Author: Only_the_truth
Reviews.Content: Good - location, clean, quiet, reception, handy for metro, China town & old Montreal. Free WIFI. Boutique style & very modern & fresh. Needs improving - buffet breakfast was limited & not very fresh, especially the muffins. Would certainly here stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: doglover123_10
Reviews.Content: Great location, minutes away from St. Catherine Street. Staff were nice. Rooms very clean and housekeeping staff were very friendly. They have a continental breakfast available and it is nice if you just want something small before starting your day. There was just a shower in the room. Rooms are very modern and the hotel itself was quite quiet. The only minor issue I had was the pillows, they were very hard and lumpy; otherwise everything was great and the bed was quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: perlusha
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel in the center of Montreal for the modern traveler.. The hotel is completely non-smoking. Rooms are large and furnishings are modern. Bathroom is large, with amazingly spacious countertop. Tiled walk-in shower has glass enclosure. However pillows are not great, and towels are very basic. Beds are very firm, probably the firmest I ever seen (forget pillowtops). On the other hand, these beds are supposed to be the best for children and people with back problems. Toiletries are of very good quality. Also bottled drinking water comes free with the room. Small fridge was very good too. Laundry facility is free; just buy the detergent for $1. Air conditioning works well and window opens also, so we could breathe fresh air. Soundproofing of the room was pretty good compared to plywood US hotels. Parking (costs extra) at next-door convention center is plentiful and so are restaurants that are very hard to pass by on your way to the garage. Do not miss â€œburning fountainâ€� show in front of the hotel every hour at 0.55 minutes! The best feature for us was a computer in our room (sadly, Vista-based). Amazingly convenient and so necessary for the modern traveler! Be prepared, however, to browse internet, use Microsoft word, etc. with French menu! Even google comes up in French! On a negative side, one has to get used to the hassle of constantly using the room key to operate the elevator or to turn on the lights, but it is a very minor inconvenience. Breakfast buffet has good selection with yogurt, several kinds of cheese, mini-croissants, hard boiled eggs, plus all the usual kinds of breakfast food, though I could not learn to love steamed kidney beans for breakfast. Juices (orange and cranberry) are very fresh. I saw the kitchen employee open a large bottle of fresh orange juice and pour it into the juice dispenser, contrary to often diluted juice in some US hotels. The bad thing is that they often run out of food long before the breakfast is over, so do not sleep late. Front desk staff is delightful. Young people who work there are friendly and helpful. Every woman (and even man) looks lovely! True, they do not smile at strangers and do not say hi to everyone who passes by as we do in the States, but they greet you and say Bonjour! They speak good English, but once there was a comical episode because they did not know what a â€œbath matâ€� means.. But they figured it out and I learned this word in French too. Staff was helpful and knowledgeable about the city and even prompted us to see some things that we would have never figured on our own. The cleaning crew had a problem. The guy who cleaned our room would forget to bring toiletries or towels, would pile all the pillows on one of the beds and leave them there, never once vacuumed.. The cleaning and kitchen staff speaks Spanish and French so itâ€™s hard to ask them directly. Overall our stay was very enjoyable and next time we will definitely stay there again! And hopefully learn some French too.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: sherreegonesouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out exactly as I had hoped from reading all of the reviews. The location is very central. It is very quiet in the hotel - rooms are clean, nicely appointed and the addition of a computer with free internet is wonderful. The breakfast is fine and the beds tend to be on the hard side, but for me that made my back feel better than usual. Could be one of the best hotels for the price in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, modern, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amalthea7c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our very short stay at Hotel Dauphin in Montreal, we wish we could have stayed longer. The location was excellent for us, we were able to walk from the train station and then walk to Old Montreal. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, we were also able to check in to our room a couple of hours early which was very nice. When we saw that our room was right next to the elevator we were very disappointed but we did the standard elevator noise check before going back to the front desk. My husband rode the elevator down a couple of floors and came back up while I listened in the room. Amazingly, I did not hear the elevator so we kept the room. During our stay we didn't hear any other noises either. The room itself does look like IKEA furnished it but besides the mattress being a bit too hard the room was comfortable. The air conditioning was modern, cold and quiet unlike the window air conditioners prevalent in many hotels. The bathroom was lovely with a walk-in, curtainless shower and very nice fixtures. It could have used a bit more counter space and a couple more hooks. The room comes with a computer (didn't use it), fridge and coffee maker which worked well. There were a few scratches on the wall and the blinds were a bit difficult to work but not really a big issue. Breakfast offered cereals, breads, fruit, etc. which was enough to get us going in the morning. If we get a chance to go back to Montreal we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: silee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my wife on a trip for a convention. The hotel is modern and clean and biggest plus is probably the computer in your room with free internet access, a service that I can't believe is rare in today's day and age. Continental breakfast is also included, unlike other hotels. The hotel is a block from the convention center and within walking distance of any shopping or dining along with Old Montreal. Arrived in Montreal a day earlier and had to stay at another downtown hotel which was fine but just didn't stack up when compared to this hotel. Undoubtedly where I'd stay again in Montreal simply because of the excellent value for my dollar, giving me everything I would want in a hotel room (fridge, dvd player, computer--so handy!), and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good, but for me, the bed was too hard.”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, right in between key distracts of the old port and the major shopping district on Ste. Catherine. Near to metro stops and across the street from one of the best urban mini parks in the city, the fountain designed by Riopelle is awesome, and the mist fountains scattered in the park are really cool, literally and figuratively. The hotel is kind of minimalist Euro-style. Our room, I think 507, had king size bed. The room was spacious, with a desk, large flat screen TV, which sat on a set of drawers. Clean, clean, clean. The coffee maker was 'fresh', not old and well used, the same for the fridge (which was quite, couldn't hear it running!). A little sitting area with two moderate size (modernish) arm chairs and little coffee table. Beside table on both sides of the bed. Bathroom is a misnomer: no bathtub. Kind of miss not having one, but the shower is spacious, good water temperatures and strength. Vanity area kind of small, but okay. Really liked that one of the windows opened. Included continental: nothing special, but did the trick: yogurt, toast, etc. surprisingly poor coffee, though. THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE: Bed too hard, the blinds on windows were nice, but there were no light blocking curtains. The in room lights were odd, there was no way just to have one light on at a time. This meant that if I was at the desk, the lights on that wall had to all be on, and thus shining on to the bed - not able to have just a desk lamp.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, modern hotel in the centre of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaHampshire
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Dauphin was our first stop on a month long Canadian holiday. As it turned out, no other hotel managed to beat it. The room was superb, and the fact that we could send emails from our room was an added bonus. Being shower lovers, we were delighted with our wet room style shower and everything was so clean. If you're looking for an amazing breakfast, this isn't the place for you but the continental breakfast is perfectly adequate. The hotel is in a good location and hotel staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Downtown Montreal Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Loudpedal
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at this hotel in Jun 2010. What a jem! We rec'd prompt attentive and friendly service our whole stay. The hotel is small (<100 rooms), and has a great studio style vibe. Although the hotel was filled to capacity during our stay, it never felt busy or cramped. The continental breakfast (included) had a great selection of fresh breakfast offerings. Here's what it was: - the quietest room I've stayed in (city hotel), with no other room noise heard - the cleanest hotel I've stayed in - great location to Old Montreal, Metro (subway), and downtown I plan on returning with my wife and other friends the next visit to Montreal. Hotel Dauphin Downtown Montreal is a great value and may be my new favorite Montreal hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel only #23 - it should be much higher on the list!”
Reviews.Author: vickieseestheworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week June 18-25, 2010 at the Hotel le Dauphin Downtown, 1/2 block from the Palais de Congres convention centre. It looks plain on the outside, but the inside has been completely remodelled and is very modern & chic European, with towering ceilings, blonde wood, black leather furniture, slate floors. Although there was some confusion regarding our reservation, we eventually ended up in Ste. 902, top floor. And a bargain price for this excellent location - 149.00/night. It was huge, with 2 flat screen TV's, our own computer (husband used laptop hooked to their free internet as well), king size bed, large L shaped black leather couch, windows that open! Air conditioning, gorgeous bathroom with double glass shower, giant oval tub you could practically swim in, lovely spa soaps and creams ! We travel a lot, and this place really was great, and also included free morning paper at your door, plus continental brekkie downstairs every morning - fresh juice, bananas, apples, an assortment of bagels (sesame Montreal bagels are the best!), muffins, croissants, cereals, yogurt, cream cheese, etc. Certainly a great way to fuel up for a busy day of sightseeing - a short 6-7 minute walk straight down the street to Old Montreal, Notre Dame, Rue St. Paul etc. Subway station Place d'armes is right at the Palais de Congress (1/2 block) to connect you to the whole city. Cabs are everywhere and can be hailed on the street or phoned and will be there in minutes. Excellent service. Also there is a great bike rental system throughout the city, pick up a bike from one location, return to another of your choice. $5.00 for a 24 hour rental. We had some great dinners - famous places such as Moishes (since 1938, in the Jewish quarter - take a cab there and walk back), Gibby's (Old Montreal) those two are revered steak houses. Schwartz's on St. Laurent is an equally old establishment, Montreal smoked meat sandwiches- always crowded, can eat in or take out - kosher dills, buy some spices - yummy. We also took a walking tour of Old Montreal - 3 hours long, we left from the Palais de Congres right near our hotel - very interesting, lots of history there for sure. Be sure to go inside Notre Dame cathedral - spectacular. Keep going back as far as you can and you will get to another awesome chapel. Bells ring on the hour. There is an awesome roof top terrace on top of the Hotel de la Montagne, (short cab ride from hotel) drinks and snacks only, no dinner - but what a view! Hotel le Dauphin simply can't be beat for the price. Have fun in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: l_beggs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We stayed for four nights, and each night's sleep was better than the last. The shower in the bathroom was amazing. Everything in the hotel was very clean, very modern and tasteful. They don't have room service, but their continental breakfast set up was great and they had a nice little breakfast room where we could sit and enjoy our food. The location was great - a decent walking distance to everything we needed - nightlife, food, tourist areas, the metro... I have only good things to say about this hotel and would recommend it to anyone in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, good location”
Reviews.Author: lifesci99
Reviews.Content: We needed a room in downtown Montreal last minute for the long weekend and this was definitely the best value (in terms of three/four star hotels) at $130/night. This was the first time I've stayed in a hotel that had a computer right in the room to check email, look up restaurants, etc. The bathroom was spa-like with its glass-enclosed shower; breakfast consisted of the usual carbs (muffins, croissants, bagels, whole wheat/white bread, dry cereal), yogurt, fruit, and a vat of baked beans. St. Catharine St. is about a 5-10 minute walk away; in 45 minutes at a leisurely pace you can make it up to St. Laurent at Mont Royal. Parking is at the Palais de Congres and it cost $18 for about 24 hours. Staff weren't particularly friendly, so the level of service is not particularly high, but if you're just looking for a reasonably priced, beautiful room within walking distance of major attractions then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: princess_twenty
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all my requirements: reasonable price, quiet, clean, modern, close to Palais de Congres, in-room internet, fridge -- everything!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it.”
Reviews.Author: giraffeoftruth
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review, I absolutely hated the place, but I know it probably is not as bad as it seems to me. First the positive, it's in a great location, really central and easy to get to the main shopping area, and to the old town. There is good wi-fi connection and a restricted buffet breakfast included. There are a couple of things I'm not sure about, the pc in the room seems like a good idea, but to be honest i wouldn't trust it with anything other than basic surfing, with no antivirus and windows defender not working properly I wouldn't connect a flash drive even though it has office on it. It also takes up space, and they have already taken a reasonable sized room and, imo, overfilled it with furniture. There are two beds when one would probably be sufficient, if someone is using the pc you have to climb over the bed to move from one end of the room to the other. The whole room feels cluttered, it's difficult to put a couple of big suitcases out of the way. There is a fair sized fridge in the room, which is also a little odd as there are notices telling you not to have food in your room. I found the bed hard, and the room was light soon after sunrise as there were only blinds rather than curtains, I was on holiday, i didn't need to get up that early! The bathroom was fine, and there was a nice walk in shower. I personally didn't think the buffet breakfast was worthwhile either, I swear they had the weakest coffee I had ever tasted. The whole place seemed like a hostel more than a hotel. I think the worst thing though was the staff were the least friendly people we'd met in three weeks of travel in Canada, in particular the woman on the desk when we checked in. My experiences seem at odds with most reviews, so it's likely that I may have just had a bad stay, but i would not recommend this place to anyone i liked.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LTNARBA
Reviews.Content: Ideal location with very clean, presentable & well-maintained rooms. Friendly staff and continental breakfast really make this hotel a gem. Slightly hard bed but that's just a side comment, not to detract from an excellent stay. Computer in every room with free internet was very impressive. Friends staying at the near-by Hyatt said they wish they would have stayed at the Hotel Dauphin, since it had more amenities and bigger rooms. Absolutely would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMcA
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms with not just free internet, but in room PCs. Included continental breakfast was a bonus. Good location close to Old Town and a choice of metro stations just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: njpmg
Reviews.Content: My cousin & I stayed here for a weekend getaway. I picked this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor. Fantastic! The location was great being a block away from a metro stop and Old Montreal. In fact, Rue Ste. Catherine was only 2-3 blocks away as well. The room was spacious, clean, modern, and relatively new. The beds were firm & comfortable. The bathroom was a little small but stylish with Grohe fixtures. Maybe it was a slow weekend, but the hotel was super quiet. I specifically asked for a quiet room, and boy, did I get one! The continental breakfast was okay; I opted for a banana and some tea. Because of the great value of the room, I indulged myself by going out for breakfast. Having an internet-connected computer in the room was wonderfully useful; hope this is a trend in other hotels! Overall, I was very happy with my stay and wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKimmer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, right beside the congress centre, and in between old town and shopping on Ste. Catherine. The rooms were great - clean, modern, and the in room computer was a nice touch. Since there are only a small number of rooms on each floor, it was nice and quiet. We were a bit disappointed with the quality of the toiletries provided, I would have expected something a little higher-end to be more in line with the vibe of the hotel. The breakfast was good, however, be warned that they treat holidays like weekdays and not weekends, so we were a bit disappointed to have missed breakfast on the holiday Monday.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Lovely.”
Reviews.Author: Allively
Reviews.Content: very nice, clean hotel. great location, friendly staff. offered an umbrella when raining. gave resturant suggestions. breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: EastSidder
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in Montreal after much back and forth over where to stay. I ended up booking this hotel based on all of the positive reviews, but really had no idea what to expect upon arrival. It was a bit tricky to find, mostly because my gps was a little cranky and because it's a smaller hotel with an unassuming entry, but once we were inside, I was more than impressed. The decor was simple and modern, and everything looked brand new and clean. My favorite feature was the beautiful bathroom and the glass shower. I also was very impressed with the fact that we had a computer with free wireless, a fridge, a safe, and a huge flatscreen tv in the room. For what we paid, this was more than what we were expecting. We only made it to the continental breakfast one morning, but we were happy with it. There wasn't any coffee left, but upon letting the staff know, they made a fresh batch for us. The front desk staff was helpful and they all spoke English. Parking wasn't too much of an issue either. We bought pre-paid tickets from the hotel and were able to park in the convention center garage next door (which is a really great building as well!) We had no issues whatsoever. The location of the hotel was excellent as well. We were located right next to the subway system and a block or two away from Notre Dame and Old Montreal. It was the perfect spot. My one complaint is that housekeeping did come to our floor really early one morning, which I thought was weird. But I can't even be too sure of that because I was half asleep still. And a pool would have been nice, but at least there was air conditioning that cooled down the room very fast. If you are looking for a very reasonably priced hotel that is clean, comfortable, and has modern ammenities, then I would recommend this place in a heartbeat. If I return to Montreal, I would def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a great hotel in central MTL - STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: steph888
Reviews.Content: So thanks to everyone's reviews and honest opinions on tripadvisor we were not disappointed when we booked this hotel for our 2 night stay this past weekend. We visit Montreal occasionally, more recently we have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, and the Travelodge in Montreal. The holiday inn Express is always okay - but it was fully booked, so we tried something new and were pleasantly surprised with Hotel Dauphin. Great Location, close to shopping, chinatown, old montreal. Great Price..it was about $30 less than Holiday inn express. Included a really good self serve continental breakfast. Amazing Room - clean, very modern for a hotel, with free high speed access (unheard of!). Great service, the hotel front staff very helpful, pleasant. We were travelling within a group of 4 families, and all were very happy with the accomodations. No complaints! Yes, the parking is a block away but it is not really a big deal, just glad that our vehicles were safe! Some guest were having problems with their magnetic cards to access the elevator, but no biggie, I just needed to jiggle mine to work. I have to say it is one of the nicest hotels i have stayed at within this price range, love the modern ammenities! Kudos to the staff & management of this first class independant hotel. We will definately rebook on our next visit in October, and recommend to all:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: TerryStratford
Reviews.Content: Only thing missing is a pool - but the rooms are great, and in a very central locale for all the events of Montreal. And great price compared to the over-priced places around it.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem, nice modern decor, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Pimwadee
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the location, and also for other amenities that come with it. This hotel is a no-fuzz hotel. The staff was always there but would not be in too much of your way -- perfect for quiet, no-fuzz travelers. The breakfast was very hearty with a great variety of different kinds of juices, drinks, toast, baked beans, etc. The most surprise of all was that the hotel provided a desktop computer in every room. If you bring your own laptop, you can unplug the Ethernet cable from the desktop and plug it into your own laptop. The room has in-room safe. The hotel looks new. Decoration is modern style with very clean room and bathroom, and a nice soft fluffy bed. I loved it and will stay there again if I have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great place!”
Reviews.Author: khtrips
Reviews.Content: This hotel was renovated in 2007, location is great, 10 minute walk to Old Montreal. Room was large and super clean with 2 comfortable queen beds, a spacious bathroom with huge shower, Flat Screen TV and computer. Room was quiet, staff very pleasant and helpful, continental breakfast with juices, cereals, some fruit and bread, etc. Overall a great deal - would definitely stay here again in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La...Tres Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Pet_McCool
Reviews.Content: Can't find a better deal in Montreal. Great location, great price. Nothing to complain about. I give it three thmbs up!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel! Close to everything, and was such a clean place w/ free Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: JcGirl87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Memorial day weekend, and I fell in love. The Hotel was in a perfect location. I think the farthest thing we walked to was 15 minutes. We were three blocks away from the Notre Dame Basilica. The lightshow was really nice. Only $10 and it was worth it (though you have to sit through a little history lesson). The show its really amazing. From the Hotel old montreal is about 5 minutes walking distance. The Port is very lovely to walk up and down on. They have a new bike system where people can rent bikes I believe up to 24 hours. I must warn you that there is a deposit of $200, so if you plan on renting the bikes make sure you use your credit card and not your debit (needless to say we flipped out with we saw the charge). It takes from 24-48 hours for the pending charges to be removed once the bikes are returned to any station. I would def. rent the bikes again. It was a great time, i'll just make sure to use my Amex lol. Catherine street is about 3 blocks away, this is where you will find the shopping stores, Old Navy, Puma, foot locker. Crescent street is filled with bars and restaurants. The subway or metro was so easy to navigate, we had no problem getting to the Biodome on it (another place you should check out) The Hotel itself was very clean. The staff was always friendly and said hi. Check in and out were smooth, and our room was ready at like 12:30!! There is a free newspaper delivered every morning, and there is complimentary breakfast (cereal, toast, muffins, bagels, juice, tea and coffee) Its enough to keep you full until lunch. The Hotel has parking downstairs, but there were able 7 so depending on how many people are at the hotel with cars, you may be in luck, and it was only $15/day The beds were extremely comfortable. The showers were very clean and the tv was big. AND there is a computer in your room with FREE internet! There is also a fridge and safe. I felt right at home, and the next time I come to Montreal I will def. stay at this hotel. I feel like i'm leaving tons of things out. There was so much to do. We didn't have a set schedule of things to do, we just went with the flow. and it worked out perfectly. The people are very friendly and laid back. If you have any questions let me know!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value + location”
Reviews.Author: Travellers88
Reviews.Content: The suite was spacious and at the cost of a regular room anywhere in downtown Montreal. You get A LOT for your money ... a computer with internet, a jaccuzi, free breakfast, two televisions, spacious room, spacious shower, etc. A real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Didnâ€™t like it at all - poor service”
Reviews.Author: alexbestoloci
Reviews.Content: Didn't like it at all. Staying was terrible. Access is very bad they give you a scheme to get to their parking so you have to go all way around to get to it. No information on their website that parking is very limited (6 parking spots in underground garage! That's it!) and is 15$ per night. Room keys don't work you have to swipe it 3-4 times to get into your room or to start elevator (we saw all customers having same problems). Breakfast which was included in price was very cheap â€“ no choice at all and same food every day. Stuff is very limited, nobody from management available on weekends and if you want to speak to manager ladies on reception say to wait till Monday!!! Stuff don't smile at all. Although hotel was empty we were given room with window facing back side with terrible view (no point to stay downtown!) and room was very small. They don't have pool in the hotel. I am completely unsatisfied and will never stay there again. NEVER

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lots of amenities in a good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Catty96
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends and shared a room with 2 double beds. The check in was quick and easy and we were given 4 room keys. The room was just as pictured and very clean. Great water pressure in the shower and the computer with internet in the room was a great feature. The room also has a mini fridge and in-room safe. The alarm clock has a docking station for an i-pod and when it goes off, it starts out quiet and works up to a louder volume and was pleasant to wake up to! The breakfast bar had more than enough selection. Location is close to everything we needed, particularly Old Montreal and Cirque du Soleil. We got parking but the small lot is very tight for a big car/SUV. We were allowed to keep our car in the lot for the remainder of our visit after we checked out for just $10, a great deal in the downtown for parking if you are going to walk around. This was a great hotel with lots of amenities in a good location with a very reasonable price for what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and pleasant boutique hotel close to the old city.”
Reviews.Author: ShellL
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and 10 and 12 year old children) stayed at the Hotel Dauphin for two nights over a very cold easter weekend. The hotel was very clean and the young women at the front desk were very helpful and kind. They all spoke both french and english. The room was somewhat small, but nicely and simply decorated. We had two king beds with soft linens, two chairs, and the TV and computer. The bathroom was very pretty but dark. There was no light in the shower stall. We were given keycards for security which allowed us to use the elevator, open the door, and turn on the lights. The breakfast was filled with mostly carb related foods - cereal, bread/bagel/homemade muffins - and some yogurt, beans, cheese, and apples. The location of the hotel was very convenient. We were in walking distance to the old city, where there were many restaurants, souvenier shops, and historic buildings. The very good science museum was close by. The metro was also very close. We were able to walk to other parts of the city as well. Overall, we had a very positive impression of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TA_Scott
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Dauphin for 2 nights in October 08. The location was excellent - just a short walk from both Notre Dame and St Catherines. Hotel is very new and modern. Rooms were large and well-appointed. Nice TV and a computer with free internet in the room were highlights. Free Breakfast was excellent. Check in/out was quick - staff were very friendly and helpful (and bilingual). Highly recommend the Dauphin if you are looking for a great location between Old Montreal and St Catherines.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a hotel by conference center”
Reviews.Author: chickles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference in September 2008. It was less than a block away from the conference center, so it was quite convenient in that respect. It was only a 20 minute walk away from the major shopping area. The hotel was always clean and quiet and the front desk staff was friendly. We forgot to bring an umbrella with us, but we were able to rent one from the front desk with a monetary deposit, which was returned when we returned the umbrella. Nice idea! There was complimentary internet and breakfast every day... the breakfast bar always included beans, which is apparently quite common in Quebec.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: NewYork20202
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new. If I return I will definetly find another hotel. The price however was not bad for what we received. At arrival no one helped us with our luggage, my mother had to push one of the carts to the front of the hotel to get our luggage from the car and than up the elevator to our third floor room. There were two staff members present, and not a lot of visitors in the lobby. Someone could have offered us some sort of help, we had just arrived from Quebec, and we had more than one suitcase. One benefit was the computer in the room this was a nice touch which I have never seen before. The t.v. was nice, and so was the modern feel of the room with a nice shower. It was clean, and the location was close to chinatown which is a nice place to visit and eat. The street this hotel is located on, is not great compared to other hotels close to more attractions. This hotel also does not have parking and our parking thing got messed up where we ended up paying more than we should have. The beds were hard, which some people I guess like, but way to hard for me. Close to Old Montreal, we were able to walk a few blocks and we were there. There was also a free breakfast which was conveniant. Our family first traveled to Quebec than Montreal, and this hotel does not compare to how nice our other hotel was. Just think in a few years, the computers and the tv will be outdated, and it may be hard to replace all of them, making this hotel older faster. Montreal is a nice city, and I think there are other better hotels out there. If your just traveling for business this is probably made better for that, than family traveling. the hotel also did not seem very busy in our stay, which I am not sure is a good/ bad thing. It was quiet which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: WYW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Dauphin for 3 nights during September 2008. Location is great - near the convention centre and walking distance of the Old Town Reception Staff: Pleasant, fluent in english & french, which is very helpful. Room: Modern, clean and a decent size. The bed was king size and very comfortable with clean and soft sheets. Room had flat screen tv, free wireless internet (computer in the room!). Lovely modern double shower room (however a light in the shower area would have been even better). As an added bonus there was a continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel Dauphin”
Reviews.Author: OntarioOpinionated
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Dauphin for two nights during the first week of September 2008. Location is great - right near the convention centre and other hot spots in downtown Montreal. The hotel must have been really renovated recently. Everything seems new. Very modern, very clean. Room was huge, flat screen tv, free wireless internet, very nice bathroom. Bed was comfortable. No view out of my room, or any others as far as I could tell. No mini-bar. However, a very nice breakfast was included. I thought the price was excellent too. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for downtown shopping”
Reviews.Author: 3horselovers
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel....modern and very clean. 5 minutes away from shopping on St. Catherine's street. Free internet access in rooms was unexpected and welcomed. Free breakfast was very convenient (bagels, toast, juice, coffee, fruit etc). Overall a great spot if you're looking for something close to shopping and not too costly. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JStravelerfromPA
Reviews.Content: We returned on Aug. 16, 2008 from an 8-day stay at Hotel Le Dauphin on Rue de Bleury in downtown Montreal and I can't say enough about how it was a great choice. My mom (in her 60s), myself (in my mid-40s) and my two daughters (ages 10 and 12) all loved the hotel. I chose it specifically because it was the only hotel in Montreal I could find that offered 2 queen beds standard. I ended up booking it online (I think room was about $147 per night) as my travel agent couldn't find me anywhere that had anything but 2 double beds and we wanted to stay in 1 room! Not only was the room clean, new (I believe the hotel only opened in 2007. Everything seemed new), well decorated, with luxurious bedding and a beautiful bathroom, they also provide a computer with internet access in each room at no additional charge, as well as a flat screen cable TV with DVD player and a refrigerator (plus 2 bottles of water per day in your room free). They have breakfast everyday in a nice breakfast room from 6 to 10 am and it includes cereals, croissants, bagels, toast, fruit, beans, coffee, tea and juices. They offer some snacks (sodas, bottled water, candy) for sale in the lobby. There is also a washing machine and dryer behind a door in the lobby restroom (can only enter with your room keycard) in case you need that and laundry soap available for sale in the lobby too. The hotel staff are French-speaking but the staff in the reception area all speak fluent English too. It is also located in a great place. It is one block from Palais de Congres (Montreal Convention Center) which is across the street from a great fountain that was originally created for the Olympics and is covered in steamy smoke and a ring of fire each night (at least it was when we were there. Not sure if it is seasonal). We were also within 2 to 3 blocks of 3 subway stops on two different lines which made getting around on the metro (which is very clean and safe and easy to take -- even my mom went alone to the casino by subway and bus) very easy! The underground mall (including shops and cafes) at Desjardins on Boulevard Renee-Levesque is within 3 blocks and you can walk through it to get to Place D'Arts subway stop (we were directed by hotel staff). The main tourist sites of Vieux Montreal (Old Montreal) are also within easy walking distance of the hotel (about 4-8 blocks depending on where you are going) and if you go out the hotel door and turn right and right around the haunted house next door, you will see Chinatown within about 1 block! Though not much was mentioned about Chinatown in guidebooks, it has good Chinese restaurants and even bakeries. This hotel is ideal if you do not need a real concierge (all the staff at the reception desk are helpful and have maps and guidebooks but there is not a real concierge), and do not need a restaurant or pool right in the hotel. I may try to talk my husband into going back for our 15th anniversary this fall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Nack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dauphin during the Jazz Festival. it's in a very convenient location, just a few blocks from the festival with China Town and Old Town also very close. The complimentary breakfast was fine, offering fruit, coffee, yogurt, pastries, and cold cereal. There is parking available at the nearby convention center for $17/day. The parking onsite was sold-out. The rooms were comfortable and clean with a mini-fridge, safe, and flat-screen TV. The bathroom had a nice walk-in shower. One complaint - the gym is a little creepy. It's in a windowless, interior room that's a little smaller than one of the guest rooms. Could be a little weird if there's more than one person in there at a time. Overall a nice place to stay with very reasonable rates. We'll probably consider staying here the next time we go to jazz fest.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: JusticePTCR
